page.title: 05ECOLOGY IN PANTON POLLUTION
page.content: The farmland in {PANTON }is cultivated by six farmers, two of whom are non- resident and four of whom are. There is a significant difference in the attitude of the residents to the non-residents. The two non-residents have removed most of the field hedges and small spinneys being motivated entirely by economic considerations. The other four farmers are carrying out hedge preservation, tree planting and show concern for preservation of wild life. perennial problems include crop-spraying, both by tractor and aeroplane, and straw-burning. This latter is now subject to a code super- vised by the local authority. The beck at{PANTON}is now showing signs of life after being polluted by a farmer using a pea spray. This destroyed all life in the river for 9 miles. The culprit was fined Â£2,OOO.
